title: Rear Ash Removal System
description: Design and implement rear-access ash removal system for masonry firebox. Key features: angled grate at rear of hearth (slopes upward to back wall), wide shallow trough beneath, removable/covered tray accessible from wood storage room. Must integrate with secondary combustion chamber and hydronic heat exchanger placement. Multi-session design effort requiring detailed technical drawings.

title: WSL Debian Claude Dev Environment
description: Single-purpose disposable Debian WSL image for Claude Code development of gastown. PREREQUISITES: WSL already running Debian instance, Claude Code already installed. Architecture: VS Code Remote-WSL as sole client, TMUX for session management, GitHub connectivity with wsl/ branch prefix. See wsl-debian-claude-plan.md for full specification.

title: Phase 0: Verify WSL Debian + Claude prerequisites
description: Verify that WSL is running a Debian instance and Claude Code is already installed. Document any additional prerequisites. This replaces the original create-image.ps1 script - no new image import needed.
close_reason: Prerequisites confirmed: WSL Debian running, Claude Code installed

title: Phase 3.2: Python + uv installation (09-python-uv.sh)
description: Install Python with uv for fast package/venv management. uv is primary package manager (pip available in optional/ if needed). Test: python3 and uv work.

title: Phase 3.3: Rust installation via rustup (10-rust.sh)
description: Install Rust via rustup (latest stable). Test: rustc and cargo compile hello world.

title: Phase 3.4: Go installation (11-go.sh)
description: Install Go latest from golang.org. Test: go version and can build hello world.

title: Phase 4.1: Clone gastown repository (12-clone-gastown.sh)
description: Clone steveyegge/gastown repo to /home/dev/gastown, install dependencies via bun/uv. Configure credential helper before clone.

title: Phase 4.2: Install Claude Code CLI (13-claude-code.sh)
description: Install Claude Code CLI and configure for gastown development. Test: claude CLI responds to commands.
close_reason: Claude Code already installed per updated scope

title: Phase 5: Master validation script (99-validate.sh)
description: Run all tests and generate comprehensive report. Image is ready when this reports all green. Covers: packages, HTTPS, permissions, firewall, git hooks, tmux, aliases, all runtimes, gastown clone, claude CLI.

title: Test framework: Assertion library (tests/lib/assertions.sh)
description: Create test assertion functions: assert_command_exists, assert_version_gte, assert_file_exists, assert_file_writable, assert_dir_writable, assert_no_listening_ports, assert_https_works, assert_git_branch_prefix, assert_exit_code.
close_reason: Completed by eca.2 agent - assertions.sh created

title: Test framework: Test runner (tests/run-tests.sh)
description: Create test runner with: run all tests, run single test by number, --quick mode (skip slow), --json output. Generates logs/test-results.json and logs/test-results.md.
close_reason: Completed by eca.2 agent - run-tests.sh created

title: Test framework: Individual test scripts (t01-t13)
description: Create 13 test scripts corresponding to each install script. Each test validates its script's outputs and supports idempotency testing (install -> test -> reinstall -> test).

title: Config files: TMUX and bash configurations
description: Create config/tmux.conf (256color, mouse, 50k history, base-index 1, fast escape, intuitive splits) and config/bashrc.additions (environment setup, PATH additions).

title: Phase 1.1: System base setup (01-system-base.sh)
description: apt update, essential packages (curl, wget, etc.), locale=en_US.UTF-8, timezone=UTC. Must be idempotent.

title: Optional fallbacks: Node.js and pip scripts
description: Create optional/node.sh (Node.js if Bun compatibility issues) and optional/pip.sh (pip if uv compatibility issues). These are fallback options, not primary path.

title: Documentation: README and usage guide
description: Create README.md documenting: purpose, quick start, script manifest, test framework, edge cases, success criteria. Reference wsl-debian-claude-plan.md for architecture details.

title: Directory structure: Create wsl-4-claude project scaffold
description: Create the full directory structure: windows/, scripts/, tests/, tests/lib/, optional/, config/, logs/. This is the foundation for all other tasks.

title: VS Code Remote-WSL integration verification
description: Verify VS Code can connect via Remote-WSL extension. Test validates VS Code server presence. This is the sole client interface per design.

title: GitHub authentication setup for gastown access
description: Configure Git credential helper for GitHub authentication before cloning gastown. May require SSH key setup or personal access token configuration.

title: Phase 1.2: SSL certificates setup (02-ssl-certificates.sh)
description: Configure CA trust store for HTTPS connections (apt, bun, uv, git). Force refresh of certificates.

title: Phase 1.3: Permissions setup (03-permissions.sh)
description: Create dev user with passwordless sudo, set umask 000 globally. No internal filesystem restrictions - this is a disposable sandbox.

title: Phase 1.4: External security hardening (04-security-external.sh)
description: Disable all inbound connections via iptables (DROP policy). No listening services. Security comes from external isolation, not internal restrictions.

title: Phase 2.1: Git setup with branch prefix hook (05-git-setup.sh)
description: Install latest Git, configure credential helper, add git nb alias for wsl/ branch prefix, create pre-push hook that warns on non-wsl branches.

title: Phase 2.2: TMUX setup for multi-agent coordination (06-tmux-setup.sh)
description: Install latest TMUX with config optimized for multi-agent work. Create default gastown session with windows: code, agents, logs. Mouse support, long history, fast escape.

title: Phase 2.3: DOS command aliases (07-dos-aliases.sh)
description: Create familiar DOS aliases: dir=ls -la, copy=cp, del=rm, cls=clear, md=mkdir -p, rd=rm -rf, move=mv, ren=mv, type=cat, attrib=ls -la. No -i flags (sandbox speed).

title: Phase 3.1: Bun runtime installation (08-bun.sh)
description: Install Bun as primary JS/TS runtime (replaces Node entirely). Use native installer for latest version. Test: bun can install packages.
